title: 104_hr3235
content: The Act may be cited as the "Office of Government Ethics Authorization Act of 1996". It grants gift acceptance authority. Section 403 of the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 is amended to authorize the Director to accept gifts on behalf of the United States for the Office of Government Ethics, with conditions and rules established for acceptance. The Director of the Office of Government Ethics is authorized to accept contributions of money, services, or property, with conditions to ensure integrity and fairness in carrying out official duties. SEC. 3. Extension of authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 1997 through 1999. SEC. 4. Repeal of display requirement and conforming amendments to various acts. Section 408 of the Act is amended to change the deadline from March 31 to April 30 for the appointment of a director. Additionally, there is a limitation on postemployment restrictions. Section 207(j) of title 18, United States Code is amended to exempt political parties and campaign committees from certain restrictions on communications and appearances, with exceptions for former Federal Election Commission officers and individuals subject to specific restrictions. The amended Section 207(j) of title 18, United States Code exempts political parties and campaign committees from communication and appearance restrictions, with exceptions for former Federal Election Commission officers and individuals subject to specific restrictions related to employment by certain entities. The curr_chunk defines terms related to political committees, including authorized committee, national committee, and national Federal campaign committee. The curr_chunk defines terms related to political committees, including national Federal campaign committee, State committee, and political party. The curr_chunk defines the term 'State' as a State of the United States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and any territory or possession of the United States. SEC. 6. PAY LEVEL. Amends Section 207(c)(2)(A)(ii) of title 18, United States Code by changing the pay level reference from "level V of the Executive Schedule" to "level 5 of the Senior Executive Service."
